info.title: Lyzr Agent API
info.description:
# Lyzr Agent API

Lyzr Agent API is a modular, universal agent framework designed to simplify the creation of LLM-based agents. The framework's architecture is divided into three main components:

## Environment

Defines the modules, features, available tools, and other configurations for your agent.

- **Endpoint**: `/environment`
- **Purpose**: Set up and configure the environment for your agent.

## Agent

Specifies your agent's configuration, including the system prompt, name, and persona. The agent operates within an environment identified by an environment ID.

- **Endpoint**: `/agent`
- **Purpose**: Configure the agent with necessary details and link it to a specific environment.

## Inference

Handles the processing and execution of tasks and conversations.

### Chat

For conversational applications.

- **Endpoint**: `/chat`
- **Purpose**: Enable real-time conversational interactions with the agent.

### Task

For long-running, task-based applications.

- **Endpoint**: `/task`
- **Purpose**: Manage and execute long-running tasks.

post.description:
Send an inference request to an A2A agent.

Args:
    agent_id: The A2A agent ID (path parameter)
    inference_request: The inference request containing message and optional context_id (request body)
    auth_user: Authenticated user
    
Returns:
    The agent's response
    
Example request body:
{
    "message": "Your prompt here",
    "context_id": "optional-context-id"
}

Get All Tools For An User

Returns:

schema.title: Response Get User Tools V3 Tools  Get

post.description:
Create a new tool from an OpenAPI schema with custom name and default parameters.

Args:
- tool_data: The OpenAPI tool creation data including:
    - tool_set_name: Name for the tool set (will be prefixed with 'openapi-')
    - openapi_schema: The OpenAPI schema
    - default_headers: Optional default headers to include in all requests
    - default_query_params: Optional default query parameters for all requests
    - default_body_params: Optional default body parameters for all requests
    - endpoint_defaults: Optional endpoint-specific default parameters
    - enhance_descriptions: Whether to enhance endpoint descriptions using OpenAI
    - openai_api_key: OpenAI API key for description enhancement

Returns:
- tool_ids: IDs of the created tools.

Example:
```
{
    "tool_ids": ["60d0fe4f5311236168a109ca", "60d0fe4f5311236168a109cb"]
}
```

schema.title: Response Create Openapi Tool Endpoint V3 Tools  Post

get.description: Get a specific memory provider by ID.

Validate AWS credentials and list existing memory resources.

This endpoint should be called after creating a memory credential to:
1. Validate the AWS credentials work
2. List any existing memory resources in the user's AWS account
3. Allow user to select an existing memory or create new

Returns:
    {
        "valid": true,
        "memories": [
            {
                "memory_id": "memory-abc123",
                "name": "my-agent-memory",
                "status": "ACTIVE",
                "created_at": "2025-01-15T10:00:00Z",
                "strategies": ["semantic"]
            }
        ],
        "message": "Found 3 existing memory resources"
    }

Get current provisioning status for a memory credential.

Use this endpoint to poll status during memory provisioning (2-3 minutes).

Returns:
    {
        "credential_id": "cred_abc123",
        "status": "creating",  // pending | creating | active | failed | validated
        "memory_id": "memory-xyz123",
        "progress": {
            "percent": 45,
            "estimated_seconds_remaining": 90,
            "message": "Creating AWS memory resource..."
        },
        "error": null
    }

List existing memory resources in user's AWS account.

Returns all memory resources found in the user's AWS account
for the region specified in the credential.

Returns:
    {
        "memories": [
            {
                "memory_id": "memory-abc123",
                "name": "my-agent-memory",
                "status": "ACTIVE",
                "arn": "arn:aws:bedrock-agentcore:...",
                "created_at": "2025-01-15T10:00:00Z",
                "event_expiry_days": 30,
                "strategies": ["semantic"]
            }
        ]
    }

post.description:
Use an existing AWS memory resource.

Select an existing memory resource from the user's AWS account
instead of creating a new one.

Args:
    memory_id: The AWS memory resource ID to use

Returns:
    {
        "success": true,
        "memory_id": "memory-abc123",
        "memory_arn": "arn:aws:bedrock-agentcore:...",
        "status": "active"
    }

Provision a new AWS memory resource with user-provided name.

Creates a new memory resource in the user's AWS account.
This is an async operation that takes 2-3 minutes.
Poll the /status endpoint to track progress.

Args:
    memory_name: Required - Name for the memory resource (AWS naming convention)
    event_expiry_days: Days before events expire (1-365, default: 30)
    memory_strategy: "semantic" | "summary" | "user_preference"

Returns:
    {
        "status": "provisioning_started",
        "credential_id": "cred_abc123",
        "memory_name": "my_agent_memory",
        "message": "Memory resource creation started. Poll /status for progress."
    }

delete.description:
Delete the AWS memory resource associated with a credential.

This deletes the actual AWS memory resource, not just the credential.
Use this when you want to clean up AWS resources.

Returns:
    {
        "success": true,
        "message": "Deleted memory resource: memory-abc123"
    }

get.description:
Validate Mem0 credentials.

Tests the API key by making a connection to the Mem0 API.
Call this after creating a memory credential to verify it works.

Returns:
    {
        "valid": true,
        "message": "Mem0 credentials validated successfully",
        "host": "https://api.mem0.ai"
    }

Get current status for a Mem0 credential.

Returns:
    {
        "credential_id": "cred_abc123",
        "status": "active",  // pending | active | failed
        "message": "Mem0 credentials validated successfully",
        "provider": "mem0"
    }

Validate SuperMemory credentials.

Tests the API key by making a connection to the SuperMemory API.
Call this after creating a memory credential to verify it works.

Returns:
    {
        "valid": true,
        "message": "SuperMemory credentials validated successfully",
        "api_url": "https://api.supermemory.ai"
    }

Get current status for a SuperMemory credential.

Returns:
    {
        "credential_id": "cred_abc123",
        "status": "active",  // pending | active | failed
        "message": "SuperMemory credentials validated successfully",
        "provider": "supermemory"
    }

It intentionally avoids session/artifact persistence features.

get.description:
Fetches documentation agents for the authenticated user.

Returns:
- A dictionary containing the status, message, and the list of documentation agents.
    - status (str): "success" if operation successful
    - message (str): message for successful operation
    - documentation_agents (list[str]): list of documentation agent IDs

post.description:
Initializes a documentation agent endpoint.

Args:
- name (str): The name of the documentation agent.
- llm_credential_id (Optional[str]): The credential ID for the language model, if any.
- provider_id (str): The provider ID for the language model.
- model_id (str): The model ID for the language model.
- top_p (float): The nucleus sampling parameter.
- temperature (float): The temperature parameter for sampling.
- auth_user (AuthUser): The authenticated user information.

Returns:
- A dictionary containing the agent ID.
    - created_agent_id (str): id of agent created

Connects a database to a RAG endpoint.

Args:
- rag_config_id (str): The ID of the RAG configuration.
- database_id (str): The ID of the database to be connected.

Returns:
- A dictionary containing:
    - connected_database_id (str): The ID of the connected database.

get.description:
Endpoint to fetch table names for a given RAG configuration and database.

Args:
- rag_config_id (str): The ID of the RAG configuration.
- database_id (str): The ID of the database.

Returns:
- A dictionary containing the schema and table names.
    - schemas_and_tables (dict): JSON of table names with their schema and included status

Endpoint to fetch a preview of a table.

Args:
- rag_config_id (str): The configuration ID for the RAG.
- database_id (str): The ID of the database.
- table_name (str): The name of the table to preview.

Returns:
- A dictionary containing:
    table_preview (list[dict]): The preview of the table records.

Endpoint to fetch descriptions for a given table in a database.

Args:
- database_id (str): The ID of the database.
- table_name (str): The name of the table.
- rag_config_id (str): The configuration ID for RAG (retrieval-augmented generation).

Returns:
- A dictionary containing:
    descriptions (dict): The fetched descriptions, keys - table_name, table_description, columns

post.description:
Endpoint to save documentation for a table.

Args:
- rag_config_id (str): The ID of the RAG configuration.
- table_name (str): The name of the table.
- descriptions (TableColumnDescriptions): Descriptions of the table columns.
- table_preview (list[dict]): A preview of the table with rows as records.

Returns:
- A dictionary containing:
    - added_table_name (str): Name of the table added to the vector store

Asynchronous endpoint to save documentation task.

Args:
- rag_config_id (str): The configuration ID for the RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) system.
- table_name (str): The name of the table for which documentation is being saved.
- descriptions (TableColumnDescriptions): Descriptions of the table columns.
- table_preview (list[dict]): A preview of the table data.
- auth_user (AuthUser): The authenticated user making the request.

Returns:
- A response object containing the task ID of the initiated documentation save task.

delete.description:
Asynchronously removes a documentation endpoint for a specified table.

Args:
- rag_config_id (str): The configuration ID for the RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) system.
- table_name (str): The name of the table to be removed from the documentation.

Returns:
- A dictionary containing:
    removed_table_name (str): The name of the table that was deleted.

Asynchronous endpoint to remove a documentation task.

Args:
- rag_config_id (str): The ID of the RAG configuration.
- table_name (str): The name of the table from which the documentation task should be removed.

Returns:
- An object containing the ID of the task that was created to remove the documentation.

get.description:
Asynchronously retrieves the status of a task given its task ID.

Args:
- task_id (str): The unique identifier of the task.

Returns:
- An object containing the task ID, status, and optionally the result or error message.
    - task_id (str): The unique identifier of the task.
    - status (str): The status of the task.
    - result (Optional[dict]): The result of the task, if available.

Possible statuses:
- "pending": The task is still pending.
- "failed": The task has failed, with an error message included in the result.
- "completed": The task has successfully completed, with the result included.
- "in_progress": The task is currently in progress.

post.description:
Upload multiple files (PDF, DOCX, or Images) and extract text content.

Supported file types:
- PDF (.pdf)
- Word Document (.docx)
- Images (.jpg, .jpeg, .png)

For PDF and DOCX files, text content will be extracted automatically.
Images are stored as-is without text extraction.

Supports both single file and multiple file uploads.

Returns a paginated list of all assets belonging to the authenticated user.

Get comprehensive dashboard with key metrics and top 5 items:

METRICS (totals):
- Active world models count
- Total personas count
- Total scenarios count
- Total test cases count
- Total evaluation runs count

TOP 5 DATA (most recent):
- Top 5 personas
- Top 5 scenarios
- Top 5 recent test case results with status & metrics
- Top 5 world models with metrics & status
- Top 5 evaluation runs summary

- World model info
- Metrics (personas, scenarios, test cases counts)
- All personas, scenarios, test cases
- Recent test cases from latest runs
- Evaluation runs summary

Get all traces with aggregated summary information.

Filters traces by parent spans that contain org_id and user_id in their SpanAttributes.

Access control based on user role:
- owner/role_owner/admin/role_admin: Can see all org traces
- member/role_builder: Can only see their own traces (filtered by user_id)
- role_member: Access denied (403)

**Query Parameters:**
- `start_time`: ISO 8601 datetime to filter traces after
- `end_time`: ISO 8601 datetime to filter traces before
- `limit`: Maximum number of results (1-1000)
- `offset`: Pagination offset
- `agent_id`: Filter by agent ID (from parent span attributes)
- `trace_id`: Filter by specific trace ID
- `session_id`: Filter by session ID (from parent span attributes)
- `query_user_id`: Filter by user ID (from parent span attributes)

schema.title: Response Get Traces V3 Traces Get

get.description:
Get complete trace data formatted for Gantt chart visualization.

This endpoint returns all spans for a given trace ID with calculated
positions, depths, and timing information suitable for rendering a Gantt chart.

**Path Parameters:**
- `trace_id`: The trace ID to visualize

**Response:**
Returns a TraceGanttChart object containing:
- `root_span`: The root span of the trace
- `spans`: All spans in the trace with calculated positions
- `total_duration_ms`: Total duration of the trace in milliseconds
- `span_count`: Total number of spans
- `start_time`: Start time of the trace
- `end_time`: End time of the trace

**Example:**
```
GET /trace/abc123def456/gantt
```

**Gantt Chart Visualization:**
Each span includes:
- `offset_ms`: Milliseconds from trace start (for x-axis positioning)
- `duration_ms`: Duration in milliseconds (for bar width)
- `depth`: Tree depth (for y-axis positioning)
- `parent_span_id`: For drawing hierarchical relationships

Get detailed summary of a trace including agent info, LLM details, tool calls, tokens, cost, and duration.

Extracts information from:
- Parent span (type=inference): Agent ID, Name, LLM provider and model
- Tool call spans: Counts of tool_call, mcp_tool_call, and aci_tool_call
- All spans: Total tokens (input/output) and total cost
- Trace duration: From trace start to end time

**Authorization:**
- Only returns traces where parent span org_id matches the authenticated user's org_id

**Path Parameters:**
- `trace_id`: The trace ID to get summary for

**Returns:**
- Detailed trace summary with agent, LLM, tool, cost, and duration information

Get trace statistics for a given time range.

**Query Parameters:**
- `service_name`: Filter by service name
- `start_time`: ISO 8601 datetime to filter traces after
- `end_time`: ISO 8601 datetime to filter traces before
- `last_hours`: Convenience parameter to get stats for last N hours (1-168)

**Example:**
```
GET /trace/statistics?last_hours=24
GET /trace/statistics?service_name=lyzr_agent&last_hours=1
```

**Response:**
```json
{
    "trace_count": 1500,
    "span_count": 15000,
    "avg_duration_ms": 250.5,
    "p50_duration_ms": 180.2,
    "p95_duration_ms": 890.1,
    "p99_duration_ms": 1520.8,
    "max_duration_ms": 5000.0,
    "min_duration_ms": 10.5
}
```

parameters.name: last_hours

schema.description: Get statistics for last N hours
schema.title: Last Hours

parameters.description: Get statistics for last N hours

get.description:
Get comprehensive dashboard metrics with daily breakdown.

Returns daily metrics for credits, latency, traces, tokens, and error rates,
along with aggregated totals and top agents/tools/modules.

Access control based on user role:
- owner/role_owner/admin/role_admin: Can see all org dashboard metrics
- member/role_builder: Can only see their own dashboard metrics (filtered by user_id)
- role_member: Access denied (403)

**Query Parameters:**
- `days`: Number of days to fetch (1-90, default 7)
- `agent_id`: Filter by agent ID (from parent span attributes)
- `session_id`: Filter by session ID (from parent span attributes)
- `query_user_id`: Filter by user ID (from parent span attributes)

Get all raw span data for a specific trace.

**Path Parameters:**
- `trace_id`: The trace ID to fetch

**Example:**
```
GET /trace/abc123def456
```

Returns all spans in the trace with complete details including
attributes, events, and links.

Get all cached credits from the credit service.

This endpoint is for server-to-server communication only.
Requires 'x-server-token' header for authentication.

**Headers:**
- `x-server-token`: Server authentication token (required)

**Response:**
Returns a dictionary with cache keys (resource__action) mapped to Credit objects.

**Example:**
```
GET /v3/credits/cache
Headers:
    x-server-token: your-server-token
```

**Response:**
```json
{
    "agent__create": {
        "resource": "agent",
        "action": "create",
        "action_cost": 0.05,
        "unit": 1,
        "version": 1,
        "is_active": true
    },
    "knowledge_base__create": {
        "resource": "knowledge_base",
        "action": "create",
        "action_cost": 1.0,
        "unit": 1,
        "version": 1,
        "is_active": true
    }
}
```

schema.title: Response Get Cached Credits V3 Credits Cache Get

post.description:
Refresh the credit cache from the database.

This endpoint is for server-to-server communication only.
Requires 'x-server-token' header for authentication.

**Headers:**
- `x-server-token`: Server authentication token (required)

**Example:**
```
POST /v3/credits/cache/refresh
Headers:
    x-server-token: your-server-token
```

**Response:**
```json
{
    "success": true,
    "message": "Credit cache refreshed successfully",
    "cached_count": 12
}
```

get.description:
List all user assets with pagination.

Assets are returned in the following order:
1. Folders
2. Agents (regular and manager agents)
3. Workflows

Query Parameters:
- page: Page number (starting from 1)
- limit: Number of items per page (1-100, default 10)
- type: Filter by asset type (all, folder, agent, manager_agent, workflow)

Returns a paginated list of unified assets with metadata.

Search user assets by name.

Performs case-insensitive search across asset names.

Query Parameters:
- q: Search query string (required)
- page: Page number (starting from 1)
- limit: Number of items per page (1-100, default 10)
- type: Filter by asset type (all, folder, agent, manager_agent, workflow)

Returns a paginated list of matching assets.

Get audit log statistics for the organization.

Returns aggregated statistics including event counts by action, resource type,
result, and severity.

Requires: audit_logs:read permission OR owner/admin role

Get combined DAU, MAU, and daily active rate for the organization.

Returns the number of daily active users, monthly active users,
and the daily active rate (DAU/MAU percentage) for the given date.

Requires: audit_logs:read permission

request on the given date.
